articles.content:
Google Play Music is closing before the year's out
Getty
Google has finally announced its killing off Play Music before the end of the year. Now millions of customers who may have uploaded their MP3 collection to the service need to make sure they dont lose… [+2216 chars]

articles.author: Adam Smith
articles.title: Dell unveils 'most powerful' XPS computer and claims world's smallest 17-inch laptop - The Independent
articles.description: The company also introduced a new model of its Alienware gaming laptop, the Area 51m R2
articles.content:
Dell has revealed an update to its XPS range of laptops. As well as the 13-inch XPS 13, the range will now include a redesigned XPS 15 and an all-new XPS 17.
The XPS 17, which has been on a 10-year hiatus, is the worlds smallest 17-inch laptop according to D… [+2429 chars]

articles.author: Sean Carey
articles.title: The Culling is coming back, but with possibly the most punishing monetisation model ever - TrueAchievements
articles.description: The Culling is getting released again on the Xbox One. This time, the game includes better graphics, better AI and a shockingly bad monetisation system that only allows you to play online once per day.
articles.content: The battle royale title, The Culling, is once again returning to Xbox One, this time with several changes, including better graphics, better AI and possibly one of the most punishing monetisation models ever seen. The Culling: Origins will cost $5.99, however… [+1856 chars]

articles.description: The more focused version of the Golf 8 GTI has been spotted undergoing testing at the Nurburgring
articles.content:
The Golf 8 GTI hasnt even been launched yet, and VW is already working on a hotter version. Thats the kind of keenness we can get on board with. 
A prototype GTI Clubsport - successor to the TCR -has been spotted hammering around the Nurburgring Nordschleife… [+1645 chars]

articles.title: If this rumour is true, there's really bad news for Samsung Galaxy Note fans - Express
articles.description: SAMSUNG is believed to be hard at work on the next Galaxy flagship, but the latest offering from the South Korean firm could be missing one huge feature we've already seen on other Galaxy smartphones launched this year.
articles.content:
Earlier this week Ross Young, the founder and CEO of DSCC, tweeted: "No Galaxy Note Ultra model, but the Galaxy Fold 2 will be your Ultra. #GalaxyNote".
Young also added: "Note 20+ will grow from 6.8" to 6.87", resolution will increase to 3096 x 1444 resulti… [+1073 chars]
